meanings.definition: A person handling payments and transactions in a store or business.
meanings.sent1: The cashiers at the supermarket scan groceries for customers.
meanings.sent2: The cashiers work diligently to ensure all transactions are processed accurately.
meanings.sent3: The cashiers joked about having a race to see who could scan items the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The cashiers are the unsung heroes of the retail world, keeping the flow of money smooth.
meanings.sent5: The friendly cashiers greeted each customer with a smile, making the shopping experience pleasant.

meanings.definition: To dismiss someone from a position, especially from military service.
meanings.sent1: The general decided to cashiers the soldier due to misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The commander had to cashiers the recruit for violating the rules.
meanings.sent3: The sergeant jokingly threatened to cashiers the private if he didn't clean his boots.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cashiers the officer was met with mixed reactions from the troops.
meanings.sent5: The military code strictly dictates when a commander can cashiers a soldier from duty.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from a position of authority or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The board of directors had to cashiers the CEO for financial misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cashiers the manager due to poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The team members were surprised when the coach announced he would cashiers the captain.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cashiers the supervisor was necessary to maintain order in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The mayor had to cashiers the city planner to bring in fresh ideas for development.
